content.question: A student dissolves a quantity of <math alttext="K N O 3, solid" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>KNO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></math> in water. What information must the student use to calculate the molarity of the aqueous solution?

choices.label: Grams of <math alttext="K N O 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>KNO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> and the density of water
Liters of <math alttext="K N O 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>KNO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> and liters of solution
Moles of <math alttext="K N O 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>KNO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> and the density of water
Moles of <math alttext="K N O 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>KNO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> and liters of solution

content.answer: Moles of <math alttext="K N O 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>KNO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> and liters of solution

skill.text: 5.A: Identify quantities needed to solve a problem from given information (e.g., text, mathematical expressions, graphs, or tables).
